wordageddon.service

Class UserSession

  • java.lang.Object
    • wordageddon.service.UserSession

  • public class UserSession
extends java.lang.Object
    Singleton class for managing the current user session. Tracks the currently logged-in user throughout the application.
    Since:
    2025
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Gregorio Barberio, Francesco Peluso, Davide Quaranta, Ciro Ronca

        Sets the current logged-in user.
        Parameters:
        user - the user to set as current

      • getCurrentUser

        public User getCurrentUser()
        Gets the current logged-in user.
        Returns:
        the current user, or null if no user is logged in

      • getCurrentUserId

        public int getCurrentUserId()
        Gets the current user's ID.
        Returns:
        the current user's ID, or -1 if no user is logged in

      • getCurrentUsername

        public java.lang.String getCurrentUsername()
        Gets the current user's username.
        Returns:
        the current user's username, or null if no user is logged in

      • isLoggedIn

        public boolean isLoggedIn()
        Checks if a user is currently logged in.
        Returns:
        true if a user is logged in, false otherwise

      • isCurrentUserAdmin

        public boolean isCurrentUserAdmin()
        Checks if the current user is an admin.
        Returns:
        true if current user is admin, false otherwise

      • getLoginTime

        public long getLoginTime()
        Gets the time when the current user logged in.
        Returns:
        the login timestamp in milliseconds

      • logout

        public void logout()
        Logs out the current user by clearing the session.

      • getSessionDuration

        public long getSessionDuration()
        Gets the session duration in milliseconds.
        Returns:
        the time since login, or 0 if no user is logged in
